enWisdom: Many a person who is afflicted is made stronger by his affliction

Wisdom: سِتَّةٌ تُخْتَبَرُ بِهَا أَخْلَاقُ الرِّجَالِ الرِّضَا وَالْغَضَبُ وَالْأَمْنُ وَالرَّهَبُ وَالْمَنْعُ وَالرَّغَبُ
enWisdom: Six things are used to gauge the character of men: [their behaviour in times of] happiness and anger, security and fear, deprivation and desire

Wisdom: عِنْدَ تَعَاقُبِ الشَّدَائِدِ تَظْهَرُ فَضَائِلُ الْإِنْسَانِ
enWisdom: During successive hardships the virtues of a person become manifest

Wisdom: عِنْدَ الْخِبْرَةِ تَنْكَشِفُ عُقُولُ الرِّجَالِ [عِنْدَ الْحَيْرَةِ]
enWisdom: In times of trial (or perplexity) the [level of] intellects of the people are revealed

Wisdom: عِنْدَ الِامْتِحَانِ يُكْرَمُ الرَّجُلُ أَوْ يُهَانُ
enWisdom: It is in times of trial that a man is [either] honoured or disgraced

Wisdom: فِي تَصَارِيفِ الْأَحْوَالِ تُعْرَفُ جَوَاهِرُ الرِّجَالِ
enWisdom: It is during the change of circumstances that the [real] gems among the people are known

Wisdom: وَالَّذِي بَعَثَ مُحَمَّداً ص بِالْحَقِّ لَتُبَلْبَلُنَّ بَلْبَلَةً وَلَتُغَرْبَلُنَّ غَرْبَلَةً وَلَتُسَاطُنَّ سَوْطَ الْقِدْرِ حَتَّى يَعْلُوَ أَسْفَلُكُمْ أَعْلَاكُمْ وَأَعْلَاكُمْ أَسْفَلَكُمْ وَلَيَسْبِقَنَّ سَابِقُونَ كَانُوا قَصَّرُوا وَلَيُقَصِّرَنَّ سَابِقُونَ كَانُوا سَبَقُوا
enWisdom: By the One who sent Muhammad (s) with the Truth, you will verily be mixed [and shaken] a complete mixing, and sifted a total sieving and fully mixed as by a ladle in a cooking pot, until those who are low from among you become high and the high ones become low, and those who have fallen behind will come forward and those who are in front will fall behind

Wisdom: ثَلَاثٌ يُمْتَحَنُ بِهَا عُقُولُ الرِّجَالِ هُنَّ الْمَالُ وَالْوَلَايَةُ وَالْمُصِيبَةُ
enWisdom: There are three things by which the intellects of people are tested: wealth, authority and adversity

Wisdom: يُمْتَحَنُ الْمُؤْمِنُ بِالْبَلَاءِ كَمَا يُمْتَحَنُ بِالنَّارِ الْخِلَاصُ
enWisdom: A believer is tested with affliction just like the purity of gold and silver is tested with fire
A person is tested by his actions, not by his words
He (‘a) said about the one whom he censured: If he is distressed he thinks [ill of Allah] and doubts [in Him]
